channel.title: diff on jdhao's blog
channel.description: Recent content in diff on jdhao's blog

item.title: Using Diffs in Vim
item.description: Diff can be used to compare two versions of the same file to find the changes. If you use vim, you can use vimdiff to compare files:

item.title: Git Diff Setup
item.description: When we run git-diff, git uses its internal diff algorithm to generate diff for changed files.

item.title: Show Git Diff When Doing Git Commit
item.description: I saw on YouTube a video made by TJ DeVries on how to contribute to the neovim project. There is a scene where he commit via git commit, and whoa, a Neovim instance appeared with three split, with top left the commit message area, top right the git-status area, and on the right the git-diff info, which is really cool.

item.title: Nifty Nvim/Vim Techniques That Make My Life Easier -- Series 9
item.description:
